trial_identification.studytitle: Comparative Study of the Efficacy and Safety of two presentations of Bimatoprost 0.03% available in Brazil: Glamigan(registered trademark) and Lumigan(registered trademark).
trial_identification.scientifictitle: In glaucoma or ocular hypertension, have the two presentations of bimatoprost 0.03% availabe in Brazil similar safety and efficacy profile?

interventions.interventions: bimatoprost 0.03% eye drops: Lumigan(registered trademark) versus Glamigan(registered trademark), 45 days of treatment with each
interventions.comparator: cross-over study: the same individual will use both bimatoprost 0.03% presentations at different time frames, and collected data will be compared. Lumigan(registered trademark) treatment cycle versus Glamigan(registered trademark) treatment cycle, 45 days each cycle, witha a 30-day washout period in between.

primaryOutcome.outcome: diurnal curve of intraocular pressure (Goldmann Applanation Tonometry, at 08:00, 10:00, 12:00, 14:00, 16:00, 18:00)
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Basal Visit (time 0 - no medication) Visit 1 (15 days with medication A) Visit 2 (45 days with medication A) Visit 3 (after 30 days of washout of medication A and 15 days with medication B) Visit 4 (45 days with medication B)

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Basal Visit (time 0 - no medication) Visit 1 (15 days with medication A) Visit 2 (45 days with medication A) Visit 3 (after 30 days of washout of medication A and 15 days with medication B) Visit 4 (45 days with medication B)

Basal Visit (time 0 - no medication) Visit 1 (15 days with medication A) Visit 2 (45 days with medication A) Visit 3 (after 30 days of washout of medication A and 15 days with medication B) Visit 4 (45 days with medication B)
Basal Visit (time 0 - no medication) Visit 1 (15 days with medication A) Visit 2 (45 days with medication A) Visit 3 (after 30 days of washout of medication A and 15 days with medication B)
Basal Visit (time 0 - no medication) Visit 1 (15 days with medication A) Visit 2 (45 days with medication A) Visit 3 (after 30 days of washout of medication A and 15 days with medication B)

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
Ocular Hypertension: - intraocular pressure higher than 21mmHg with no medication -normal visual field test -normal optic nerve appearance
Glaucoma: -intraocular pressure higher than 21mmHg with no medication -glaucomatous visual filed test -glacuomatous optic nerve appearance
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: - visual acuity worse than 20/40 (Snellen scale) - intraocular pressure higher than 36mmHg with medication - diabetes -intraocular laser or surgery on the last 6 months -ocular trauma on the last 6 months

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: Ophthalmology Department of the State University of Campinas
sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: Rua Vital Brasil, 251 Distrito de Barao Geraldo Campinas Sao Paulo

fundingsource.fundingaddress: Rua Dr Emilio Rimas, 188 Cambui Campinas Sao Paulo

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The primary purpose of the study is to compare the safety and efficacy of the two avalable presentations of bimatoprost 0.03% in Brazil. We intent to compare the reduction of the intraoclular pressure with the two deifferent presentations and observe the incidence of side effects.
